com.redhat.rhn.taskomatic.task.threaded

Class TaskQueueFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.redhat.rhn.taskomatic.task.threaded.TaskQueueFactory

  • public class TaskQueueFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides an easy-to-use way to locate and use threaded work queues. Each queue is only created once.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      TaskQueue createQueue(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Class driverClass, Logger loggerIn)
      Create the queue, if it doesn't exist already.

      Get the singleton instance
      TaskQueue getQueue(java.lang.String name)
      Retrieves a queue by name
      TaskQueue removeQueue(java.lang.String name)

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static TaskQueueFactory get()
        Get the singleton instance
        Returns:
        the single instance of TaskQueueFactory

      • getQueue

        public TaskQueue getQueue(java.lang.String name)
        Retrieves a queue by name
        Parameters:
        name - queue name
        Returns:
        queue if found, otherwise null

      • createQueue

        public TaskQueue createQueue(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.Class driverClass,
                    Logger loggerIn)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Create the queue, if it doesn't exist already. If the queue has been created on a previous call to createQueue(), then that instance is returned instead.
        Parameters:
        name - queue name
        driverClass - class to use as the queue driver
        loggerIn - queue logger
        Returns:
        queue instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - error occurred during queue creation

      • removeQueue

        public TaskQueue removeQueue(java.lang.String name)
        Removes the queue from the map of available queues. This DOES NOT shutdown the queue or perform any cleanup.
        Parameters:
        name - queue name
        Returns:
        queue instance if found, otherwise null
